Google Analytics for GA4 (App+Web)

Source: R/app_web_functions.R
google_analytics_aw.Rd

Fetches Google Analytics data for Google Analytics 4 (Previously App+Web)

google_analytics_aw(
  propertyId,
  metrics,
  date_range,
  dimensions = NULL,
  dimensionFilter = NULL,
  dimensionDelimiter = "/",
  metricFilter = NULL,
  orderBys = NULL,
  limit = 100,
  realtime = FALSE
)

Arguments

propertyId

A Google Analytics App + Web property id
metrics

The metrics requested and displayed
date_range

A vector of length two with start and end dates in YYYY-MM-DD format
dimensions

The dimensions requested and displayed
dimensionFilter

The filter clause of dimensions
dimensionDelimiter

If combining dimensions in one column, the delimiter for the value field
metricFilter

The filter clause of metrics
orderBys

Specifies how rows are ordered in the response
limit

The number of rows to return - use -1 to return all rows
realtime

If TRUE then will call the real-time reports, that have a more limited set of dimensions/metrics - see https://developers.google.com/analytics/trusted-testing/analytics-data/realtime-basics

Details

See also

Google Documentation

Other BatchRunReportsRequest functions: BatchRunReportsRequest()

Examples


if (FALSE) {

# send up to 4 date ranges
multi_date <- google_analytics_aw(
  206670707,
  metrics = c("activeUsers","sessions"),
  dimensions = c("date","city","dayOfWeek"),
  date_range = c("2020-03-31", "2020-04-27", "2020-04-30", "2020-05-27"),
  dimensionFilter = ga_aw_filter("city", "Copenhagen", "EXACT"),
  limit = 100
  )


# metric and dimension expressions

# create your own named metrics
met_expression <- google_analytics_aw(
  206670707,
  metrics = c("activeUsers","sessions",sessionsPerUser = "sessions/activeUsers"),
  dimensions = c("date","city","dayOfWeek"),
  date_range = c("2020-03-31", "2020-04-27"),
  dimensionFilter = ga_aw_filter("city", "Copenhagen", "EXACT"),
  limit = 100
  )

# create your own aggregation dimensions
dim_expression <- google_analytics_aw(
  206670707,
  metrics = c("activeUsers","sessions"),
  dimensions = c("date","city","dayOfWeek", cdow = "city/dayOfWeek"),
  date_range = c("2020-03-31", "2020-04-27"),
  dimensionFilter = ga_aw_filter("city", "Copenhagen", "EXACT"),
  limit = 100
  )

# run a real-time report (no date dimension allowed)
realtime <- google_analytics_aw(
  206670707,
  metrics = "activeUsers",
  dimensions = "city",
  dimensionFilter = ga_aw_filter("city", "Copenhagen", "EXACT"),
  limit = 100,
  realtime = TRUE)

}
